summary: This is a letter from attorneys representing the estate of Jeffrey Epstein to the Metropolitan Correctional Center's legal department, formally requesting specific documents and records related to Epstein's death in custody. The letter cites concerns about irregularities at the facility and references statements from the Bureau of Prisons and Attorney General William Barr. It is a formal FOIA-style request to aid the estate's independent investigation.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at approximately 6:30 a.m. He was pronounced dead at a hospital.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the morning of August 10, 2019, while awaiting trial.
Epstein's estate, through its attorneys, is formally requesting specific evidence from the MCC for a 25-hour period surrounding his death, including video, logs, and guard records.
The letter cites Attorney General William Barr's public concern about 'serious irregularities' at the facility following Epstein's death.
The New York City Office of Chief Medical Examiner initially declined to immediately release a cause of death determination, citing a need for 'further information.'
The FBI was investigating the incident at the time of this letter.
